long_definition: the disorder is characterized by ucchvāsarōdhi [restricted expiration], daurgandhyam [bad smell of the mouth/hallitosis]

the disorder is characterized by pacatyannaṁ taikṣṇyādāśu muhurmuhuḥ/ muhurmuhuḥ prabhūtamapi upayuktamannam āśutaraṁ pacati [quick digestion of food despite of frequent and extra quantity intake], dhātūñchōṇitādīn pacati [digest the dhātu like rakta etc.], daurbalyam [weakness], ātaṅkānmr̥tyuṁ cōpanayēnnaram [succumbs to death being afflicted by diseases.], bhuktēऽnnē labhatē śāntim [person feels pacified after eating food], jīrṇamātrē pratāmyati [tremors after the digestion of food], tr̥ṭ [thirst], śvāsaḥ [breathlessness/difficult breathing], dāhaḥ [burning sensation], mūrcchā [syncope/attacks of swooning], pākāntē ca galatālvōṣṭhaśōṣadāhasantāpān janayati [dryness, burning sensation in throat, palate, lips at the end of digestion]

the disorder is characterized by uccaiḥ śvasiti saṁrabdhō mattarṣabha ivāniśam / uddhūyamānaḥ saṁrabdhō mattarṣabha ivāniśam [takes deep respiration incessantly produce a sound just like an excited and restrained], uddhūyamānavātō yaḥ śabdavadduḥkhitō naraḥ [person on account of vāyu], pranaṣṭajñānavijñānaḥ [loss of knowledge, wisdom/conciousness], vibhrāntalōcanaḥ/vibhāntanayanaḥ [one who rolls the eyes or casts side glances], vibhrāntānanaḥ [confused face/wide open mouth], vikr̥tākṣi [distorted eyes/dilated eyes], vikr̥tānanaḥ [ugly faced], baddhamūtraḥ [retention of urine], baddhavarcaḥ [retained stool/contipation], viśīrṇavāk [shattered voice], dīnaḥ [timid or apathy], dūrāt vijñāyatē bhr̥śaṁ praśvasitam [dyspnoea is recognized from far distance also], niḥsaṁjñaḥ/muhurmuhyan [frequent fainting/unconsciousness], pārśvaśūlārtaḥ [pain in sides of chest/flanks], śuṣkakaṇṭhaḥ [dryness of throat], atighōṣavān [with high sound], saṁrabdhanētraḥ [bulging of eyes], āyamya yaḥ śvasyāt [stretching of body on breathing], mahatā nādēna śvasiti [breathing with high sound], krathan [snoring due to obstruction to respiration], vakṣaḥ samākṣipan [convulsive movement of chest], karṇātiruk [severe pain in ears], śaṅkhātiruk [severe pain in temporal region], śirōऽtiruk [severe pain in head]

the disorder is characterized by dīrghaṁ śvasiti yastūrdhvaṁ na ca pratyāharatyadhaḥ / dīrghaṁ ūrdhvaṁ śvasiti ūrdhvāt na ca pratyāharatyadhaḥ [not able to deep breathing, only shallow breathing], ūrdhvadr̥ṣṭirvipaśyan [his eyes turns upwards/upward gaze], vibhrāntākṣa itastataḥ/vīkṣatē bhrāntam akṣiṇī paritaḥ kṣipan [rolling of eyes in all directions], pramuhyan [fainting], vēdanārtaḥ/paridēvī [severe pain], śuṣkāsyaḥ (śuklāsyaḥ iti pāṭhabhēdaḥ) [dryness of mouth/whitishness of mouth], aratipīḍitaḥ [severe distress/dicontent/restlessness], ūrdhvaśvāsē prakupitē hi adhaḥśvāsō nirudhyatē [deep breathing is hampered due to shortness of breath], muhyataḥ/muhuśca mūḍhaḥ [fainting], tāmyataḥ [distressed], asūn hanti [leads to death], ūrdhvaprēkṣī/ūrdhvadr̥k [upward gaze], hataravaḥ/niruddhavāk [obstructed /suffocated voice]

the disorder is characterized by ānāhaḥ/ādhmātaḥ/sānāhaḥ [barborygmus with distention], svēdārtaḥ/sasvēdaḥ [with perspiration], mūrcchārtaḥ/samūrcchaḥ [syncope/attacks of swooning], dahyamānēna bastinā/bastidāhaḥ [burning in the bladder], viplutākṣaḥ [confused dilated eyes], parikṣīṇaḥ śvasan [excessively weak respiration], raktaikalōcanaḥ [redness of one eye], vicētaḥ/vicētanaḥ [senseless/unconciousness], pariśuṣkāsyaḥ/śuṣkāsyaḥ [dryness of mouth], vivarṇaḥ [discolouration of face], pralapan [excess talking/irrelevant speech/incoherent speech], vicchinnaḥ (vimuktasandhibandhaḥ) [afflicted with (loosening of joints/ligaments)], sarujam/marmacchēdarujārditaḥ [with pain/pain due to affliction of marma- vital points], bastinirōdhavān [supression of urine], adhōdr̥k [downward gaze], muhyan [fainting], dīnaḥ [timid or apathy], naṣṭacchāyaḥ [loss of lustre/charm], vijahāti asūn/prajahāti asūn [leads to death]

the disorder is characterized by pīnasam [cold, catarrh], ghurghurakam/kaṇṭhaghurghurikānvitaḥ [making ghurghur sound], atīva-tīvravēgaṁ śvāsaḥ/tīvravēgaṁ śvāsam [severe increased respiratory rate/tachypnea], prāṇaprapīḍakam/prāṇōpatāpinam [life threatening], ativēgāt pratāmyati/pratāmyēt tasya vēgēna/tamakapīḍitaḥ [fainting due to tachypnea], kāsatē/sakāsaḥ/kāsam [cough], sannirudhyatē [motionless], kāsamānaśca pramōhaṁ muhurmuhuḥ gacchati [frequent fainting while coughing], ślēṣmaṇi amucyamānē tu bhr̥śaṁ bhavati duḥkhitaḥ [distressed as unable to spit out phlegm], saśāmyati kaphē hīnē [feels better with little spitting of phlegm], tasyaiva ca (ślēṣmaṇi) vimōkṣāntē muhūrtaṁ labhatē sukham / niṣṭhyūtāntē kṣaṇaṁ sukhī [feels better for a while due to spitting of phlegm], kaṇṭhaḥ uddhvaṁsatē [inflammation of throat (pharynx, larynx)], kr̥cchrācchaknōti bhāṣitum [hardly able to speak], nidrāṁ na labhatē [loss of sleep/insomnia], śayānaḥ śvāsapīḍitaḥ/kr̥cchrāt śayānaḥ śvasiti [difficulty in sleeping position/unable to sleep], pārśvē avagr̥hṇāti [hindering in respiration by sides of chest due to vāta], āsīnō labhatē saukhyam / niṣaṇṇaḥ svāsthyamr̥cchati [feels comfortable in sitting posture], uṣṇaṁ caiva abhinandati / uṣṇaṁ kāṅkṣati [desire for hot], ucchritākṣaḥ [bulging of eyes], lalāṭēna svidyataḥ [sweating on forehead], bhr̥śam artimān [sudden onset of pain], viśuṣkāsyaḥ [dryness of mouth], muhuḥ śvāsō muhuścaiva avadhamyatē [body moves along with respiration during attack.], mēghāmbuśītaprāgvātaiḥ ślēṣmalaiśca abhivardhatē/vivarddhatē [aggravation of attack due to clouds, rain, cold, wind coming from front and others which increase kapha], tr̥ṭ-prāyaḥ/tr̥ṣyatē/tr̥ṣam [thirst], svēda-prāyaḥ [perspiration], vamathu-prāyaḥ [vomiting], viśēṣāt durdinē tāmyēt [more distressed on bad weather day], ghōṣēṇa mahatā āviṣṭaḥ [associated with large sound], sakaphaḥ [with sputum/phlegm], annadviṭ [person having aversion towards food], aruciḥ [tastelessness], suptaḥ [numbness], svapataśca vivardhatē [increased on sleep], mōham [confusion/delirium], savēpathuḥ [tremor]
the disorder is characterized by jvaraḥ [fever], mūrcchā [syncope/attacks of swooning], śītaiḥ śāmyēt [relieves with cold regime]

the disorder is characterized by tamasā vardhatēऽtyartham [dyspnoea increasd when there is darkness], śītaiścāśu praśāmyati [relives quicky with cold regime], majjatastamasīva [feeling as if submerged in the darkness]

the disorder is characterized by na duḥkhēnāṅgaprabādhakaḥ [not very troublesome], na gātrāṇi hinasti [does not harms the body], na duḥkhō yathētarē [not distressul], na ca bhōjanapānānām ucitāṁ gatiṁ niruṇaddhi [does not hamper intake of food, liquids etc..], nēndriyāṇāṁ vyathām, [not painful for sense organs], na kāṁcidāpādayēdrujam [does not give rise to any emergency]

the disorder is characterized by atisārō jvarō hikkā chardiḥ śūnāṇḍamēḍhratā [afflicted with diarrhoea, pyrexia, hiccup, vomiting, scrotal oedema], jvaraccharditr̥ṣṇātīsāraśōphinam [afflicted with pyrexia, vomiting, thirst, diarrhoea, oedema], yasya mūtraṁ purīṣaṁ ca grathitaṁ sampravartatē| nirūṣmaṇō jaṭhariṇaḥ śvasanō na sa jīvati| [one who is having diminution of agni and passes hard stools, urine will not survive]

the disorder is characterized by rūkṣaḥ svaraḥ [harsh voice], kṣāmaḥ svaraḥ [weak and feeble voice], calaḥ svaraḥ [trembling/shaky voice], bhinnaṁ svaraḥ [hoarse voice], śanairvadati (vācanam) [slow speech], gadgadavat svaraḥ [stuttering/stammmering], gardabhavatkharaṁ svaraḥ [harsh voice as donkey], kr̥ṣṇanayanaḥ [blackish discolouration of eyes], kr̥ṣṇānanaḥ [blackish discolouration of face], kr̥ṣṇamūtraḥ [blackish discolouration of urine], kr̥ṣṇavarcaḥ [blackish discolouration of feces], śūkapūrṇābhakaṇṭhatvam [throat filled with awn of barley], snigdhōṣṇōpaśayaḥ [relieves with unctuous and hot measures]

the disorder is characterized by tālupariplōṣaḥ/tāludāhaḥ [burning sensation of palate], kaṇṭhapariplōṣaḥ/galadāhaḥ [burning sensation inkaṇṭha/throat], vaktum asūyatē/uktau asūyanam [not willing to speak], pītavadanaḥ/pītānanaḥ [yellowish discolourtion of face], pītākṣi/pītanayanaḥ [yellowness of eyes], pītapurīṣaḥ/pītavarcaḥ [yellowness of stool], pītamūtram [yellowish urine], galēna paridāhasamanvitēna brūyāt [burning sensation in throat], tāluśōṣaḥ [dryness of palate], galaśōṣaḥ [dryness of throat]

the disorder is characterized by svarabhēdaḥ [hoarseness of voice], vibaddhasvaraḥ [obstructed /suffocated voice], khurakhurāyatē [rattling sound], kr̥cchrāt svaraḥ [voice comes with difficulty], satataṁ kapharuddhakaṇṭhaḥ [throat always chocked with secretions], mandaṁ śanairvadati [speaks little and slowly], divāviśēṣaḥ [distinct during the daytime], limpanniva kaphātkaṇṭham [feels as if throat is smeared with phlegm]
the disorder is characterized by vacasaḥ avyaktatā [unable to speak]
the disorder is characterized by dhūpyēta vāk / dhūmāyatīva cātyartham [fumigation], hatavāk [obstructed /suffocated voice], kaṣēt [rubbing/scrapping of throat]

the disorder is characterized by antargatasvaram/antargalaṁ svaram [speaks inaudibly within his throat], alakṣyapadaṁ vadati [indistinct syllables], cirēṇa vadati [delayed speech], tr̥ṣārtaḥ [thirst], digdhagalaḥ [coated /smeared throat], digdhauṣṭhaḥ [coated /smeared lips], digdhatāluḥ [coated /smeared palate], kr̥cchralakṣyākṣaraḥ [difficulty in pronouncing syllables]
the disorder is characterized by sannaḥ svaraḥ [feeble], svaraḥ kr̥cchrāt pravartatē [voice comes with difficulty]
the disorder is characterized by kaṣaṇaḥ [rubbing/scrapping of throat]
the disorder is characterized by kaphavātikalakṣaṇāni [signs of kapha and vata svarabhēda]

the disorder is characterized by urō virujyatē [wounded chest/consumption/breaking blood vessel in chest], urō bhidyatē [torn chest], urō vibhajyatē [split open chest due to wound], pārśva prapīḍanam [severe pain in flanks], aṅgaśōṣaḥ [emaciation of body], pravēpanam [tremor/shaking], vīryahāniḥ [loss of virality], balahāniḥ [loss of physical strength or weakness], varṇahāniḥ [loss of complexion/lustre], rucihāniḥ [loss of taste], agnihāniḥ [loss of agni (digestive power)], jvaraḥ [fever], vyathā [uneasiness/agitation/feeling of discomfort], manōdainyam [meanness], viḍbhēdaḥ [altered feces/loose motions], kāsamānē duṣṭa-ślēṣmā pravr̥ttiḥ [bad sputum on coughing], kāsamānē śyāva-ślēṣmā pravr̥ttiḥ [brown coloured sputum on coughing], kāsamānē sudurgandha-ślēṣmā pravr̥ttiḥ [bad odour sputum on coughing], kāsamānē pīta-ślēṣmā pravr̥ttiḥ [yellowish sputum on coughing], kāsamānē vigrathita-ślēṣmā pravr̥ttiḥ [thick sputum on coughing], kāsamānē bahu-ślēṣmā pravr̥ttiḥ [excess sputum on coughing], kāsamānē sarakta-ślēṣmā pravr̥ttiḥ [sputum with blood on coughing], atyartham kṣīyatē [severe wasting/depletion]
the disorder is characterized by anannābhilaṣaṇam [disinclination for food], arōcakaḥ [tastelessness], avipākaḥ [indigestion], chardiḥ [vomiting]

the disorder is characterized by hr̥ttōdaḥ [needling pain in heart], nābhitōdaḥ [needling pain in umbilicus], pāyutōdaḥ/gudatōdaḥ [needling pain in anus], udaratōdaḥ [needling pain in abdomen], kukṣitōdaḥ [needling pain in abdomen/sides], kōṣṭhatōdaḥ [needing pain in abdominal organs], gātrāvasādaḥ/gātrasādaḥ [exhaustion or tirednes to body], anilasannirōdhaḥ [supression of flatus], viṭsaṅgaḥ/malagrahaḥ [retension of faeces], ādhmānam [abdominal distension], avipākaḥ [indigestion]

the disorder is characterized by vijjalaṁ purīṣam (pravr̥ttiḥ) [defecation of feces with more water content/watery stools], āmaṁ purīṣam (pravr̥ttiḥ) [feces with āma/unformed stools], viplutaṁ purīṣam (pravr̥ttiḥ) [broken/unformed stools], avasādi purīṣam (pravr̥ttiḥ) [stools sinks in water], rūkṣaṁ purīṣam (pravr̥ttiḥ) [dry stools], dravaṁ purīṣam (pravr̥ttiḥ) [watery stools], saśūlaṁ/śūlāviṣṭaṁ/ purīṣam (pravr̥ttiḥ) / śūlāḍhyam upavēśyatē [defecation with pain], āmagandhaṁ purīṣam (pravr̥ttiḥ) [stools with odour of āma (smelling like raw meat)], īṣatśabdam aśabdaṁ vā purīṣam (pravr̥ttiḥ) [defecation with little sound], vibaddhamūtram/saktamūtram [supression of urine], vibaddhavātam [supression of flatus], antrakūjī [barborygmus/gurgling sound of intestines], srastāpānaḥ/bhraṣṭapāyuḥ [anal prolapse/rectal prolapse], sannakaṭiḥ [exhausted back], sanna-ūruḥ [exhausted thighs], sannajaṅghaḥ [exhausted calf muscles], alpamalpaṁ varcaḥ muñcati/alpamalpaṁ śakr̥t(pravr̥ttiḥ) [small quantities], saphēnaṁ varcaḥ muñcati / phēnila-śakr̥t (pravr̥ttiḥ) [frothy faecal matter], rūkṣaṁ varcaḥ muñcati / rūkṣaṁ-śakr̥t (pravr̥ttiḥ) [dry faecal matter], śyāvaṁ varcaḥ muñcati [dark brown colour], sānilaṁ varcaḥ muñcati [feces with flatus], śabdāḍhyam upavēśyatē [defecation with large sound], vibaddham upavēśyatē [formed stools], accham upavēśyatē [clear stools], grathitam upavēśyatē [compact stools], muhurmuhuḥ upavēśyatē / muhurmuhuḥ śakr̥t (pravr̥ttiḥ) [frequent defecation], dagdhaguḍābhāsam upavēśyatē [stools as burnt jaggary], sapicchāparikartikam [frothy stools with cutting pain in anus], śuṣkāsyaḥ [dry mouth], hr̥ṣṭarōmaḥ [horripilation], aruṇa-śakr̥t (pravr̥ttiḥ) [slightly reddish faecal matter], saruk-śakr̥t (pravr̥ttiḥ) [griping pain], saśabda-śakr̥t(pravr̥ttiḥ) [gurgling sound], viniṣṭanan [groan loudly]

short_definition: pakva state of atisāra due to vāta
long_definition: the disorder is characterized by āmātisāraviparītaliṅgāni [opposite features of āmātisāra], lāghavam [feeling of lightness], vibaddham [formed stools], alpālpam [scanty stools], saśabdam [with sound], saśūlaphēnapicchāparikartikam [defecation of stools with mucus and cutting pain in anus], hr̥ṣṭarōmaḥ [horripilation], viniḥśvasan [defecation with expiratory sound], śuṣkamukhaḥ [dryness of mouth], kaṭiśūlam [low backpain], ūruśūlam [pain in thighs], trikaśūlam [pain in sacroiliac region], jānuśūlam [pain in knees], pr̥ṣṭhaśūlam [pain in back], pārśvaśūlam [pain in sides of chest/flanks], bhraṣṭagudaḥ [rectal prolapse], muhurmuhuḥ vigrathitaṁ purīṣam upavēśyatē [frequent defecation of formed hard stools]

the disorder is characterized by hāridraṁ purīṣam atisāryatē [defecation of yellow coloured stools], hāritaṁ purīṣam atisāryatē [defecation of greenish stools], nīlaṁ purīṣam atisāryatē [bluish stools], kr̥ṣṇaṁ purīṣam atisāryatē [black stools], raktapittōpahitaṁ purīṣam atisāryatē [stools with blood and pitta], atidurgandhaṁ purīṣam atisāryatē / durgandhi [foul stools], tr̥ṣṇā [thirst], dāhaḥ (sarvāṅgaḥ) [burning sensation], svēdaḥ/svinnadēhaḥ [perspiration], mūrcchā [syncope/attacks of swooning], śūlam [colicky pain in the abdomen], bradhnasantāpaḥ/pāyusantāpaḥ [burning sensation of anus], bradhnapākaḥ/pāyupākaḥ [suppuration of anus], uṣṇam [hot], vēgavat [with speed], māṁsatōyaprakhyam [resemble raw meat washings], bhinnam [watery stools/unformed], atitīkṣṇam [severe form], pītaṁ varcaḥ muñcati / pīta-śakr̥t(pravr̥ttiḥ) [yellowish stool], nīlaṁ varcaḥ muñcati / -śakr̥t(pravr̥ttiḥ) [bluish stool], ālōhitaṁ/saraktaṁ varcaḥ muñcati [bloody stool], jvaraḥ [fever], śādvalaprabhaṁ upavēśyatē [defecation of grassy stools]

the disorder is characterized by snigdhaṁ purīṣam atisāryatē [defecation of greasy/unctuous stools], śvētaṁ/śuklaṁ purīṣam atisāryatē [whitish faeces], picchilaṁ purīṣam atisāryatē [slimy feces], tantumat purīṣam atisāryatē [feces with fibres/thready], āmaṁ purīṣam atisāryatē [feces with ama/unformed stools], guru purīṣam atisāryatē [heavy stools], durgandhaṁ purīṣam atisāryatē [foul odour], ślēṣmōpahitaṁ/ślēṣmayuktaṁ purīṣam atisāryatē [faeces mixed with mucus], anubaddhaśūlaṁ purīṣam atisāryatē/anubaddharuk [associated with pain], alpālpaṁ purīṣam atisāryatē [scanty stools], abhīkṣṇaṁ purīṣam atisāryatē [frequent defecation], sapravāhikaṁ purīṣam atisāryatē [defecation with straining], udaragurutā [heavyness in abdomen], gudagurutā [heaviness in anus], bastigurutā [heaviness in basti/urinary bladder], vaṅkṣaṇadēśagurutā [heaviness in groins], kr̥tēऽpi akr̥tasaṁjñaḥ [feeling of incompleted defecation], lōmaharṣaḥ/rōmaharṣaḥ/hr̥ṣṭarōmā [horripilation], utklēśaḥ [nausea/provocation of dōṣa], nidrāparītaḥ/nidrāluḥ [sleepiness], tantumat purīṣam atisāryatē [feces with fibres/thready], sadanaḥ/sādī [exhaustion], annadvēṣī/bhaktadvēṣī [person having aversion towards food], tandrā [drowsiness/lassitude], sr̥ṣṭaviṭkōऽpi bhūyaḥ vēgāśaṅkī [loose stools], sāndraṁ varcō muñcati [viscid faeces], niḥsvanaḥ [without sound], ghanaṁ upavēśyatē [thick stools], vibaddham upavēśyatē [formed stools], śīta-śakr̥t [defecation of faeces of cold nature]

the disorder is characterized by tandrāyuktaḥ [having lassitude], mōhaḥ [confusion/delirium], sādaḥ [exhaustion or tirednes of body], āsyaśōṣī [dryness in mouth], naikavarṇaṁ varcaḥ [stools of various colours], tr̥ṣārtaḥ [thirst], varāhasnēha-sadr̥śaṁ śakr̥t [boar fat like stools], māṁsambu-sadr̥śaṁ śakr̥t [meat washing like stools]
the disorder is characterized by kṣipram [spontaneously], uṣṇam [stool hot to touch], dravam [loose motion], plavam/apsu plavati [floats on water]

the disorder is characterized by kākaṇantīprakāśaṁ raktaṁ varcōmiśraṁ niḥpurīṣaṁ (viḍvimiśram aviḍvā) vā kr̥cchrāt sāryatē [defecation of reddish blood (resembling kākaṇatī) with or without stool], nirgandhaṁ sagandhaṁ (nirgandhaṁ gandhavat) vā raktaṁ kr̥cchrāt sāryatē [defecation of blood with or without an odour with difficulty]

the disorder is characterized by nānāvarṇaṁ naikaśaḥ sārayanti [variegated colouration], śūlōpētam (purīṣa-pravr̥ttiḥ) [pain during defecation], nyastamapsvavasīdati / gauravāt śakr̥t apsu majjati [stools sink when dropped in water], bhr̥śadurgandhi-purīṣam/śakr̥ddurgandham [very foul smelling stool], āṭōpaḥ [gurgling sound of the intestines/barborygmus], viṣṭambhaḥ [constipation/fullness in the abdomen], artiḥ [pain], prasēkī [excessive salivation], vicchinnaṁ purīṣam [split, broken/unformed stools], picchilaṁ purīṣam [stools with mucus]

the disorder is characterized by raktamiśritam [mixed with blood], tr̥ṣṇā/tr̥ṣā [thirst], śūlam [colicky pain in the abdomen], vidāham [internal burning sensation], gudapākaḥ [proctitis], jvaram [fever], dāham [burning sensation]

short_definition: atisāra which is difficult to manage
long_definition: the disorder is characterized by hāridraṁ śakr̥d upavēśyatē [defecation of yellowish stools], haritaṁ śakr̥d upavēśyatē [greenish stools], nīlaṁ śakr̥d upavēśyatē [bluish stools], māñjiṣṭhaṁ śakr̥d upavēśyatē [reddish stools], māṁsadhāvanasannikāśaṁ śakr̥d upavēśyatē [raw meat washings stools], raktaṁ śakr̥d upavēśyatē [stools with blood], kr̥ṣṇaṁ śakr̥d upavēśyatē [blackish stools], śvētaṁ śakr̥d upavēśyatē [whitish faeces], varāhamēdaḥsadr̥śaṁ śakr̥d upavēśyatē [boar fat like stools], anubaddhavēdanamavēdanaṁ vā śakr̥d upavēśyatē [painful or painless defecation], grathitaṁ śakr̥d upavēśyatē [compact stools], sakr̥t āmaṁ śakr̥d upavēśyatē [stools with āma], anatikṣīṇaśōṇitam [not too much depletion of blood], anatikṣīṇabalam [not too much depletion of strength], mandāgniḥ [diminution of agni], vihatamukharasaḥ [loss of taste of mouth]

the disorder is characterized by pakvaśōṇitābhaṁ atisāryamāṇam [defecation of stool resembling mature blood], yakr̥tkhaṇḍōpamaṁ/yakr̥tkhaṇḍanibhaṁ atisāryamāṇam [resembles the piece of liver reddish the disorder is characterized by śiraḥ mandarujā [mild headache], śiraḥ suptaṁ [numbness in head], śiraḥ stimita [numbness and heaviness in head], śiraḥ bhārikam/śiraḥ guruḥ/mūrdhā gurutā/ śirō-gauravam [heaviness of the head], tandrā [drowsiness/lassitude], ālasya [lethargy], arōcakaḥ/aruciḥ [tastelessness], śūnākṣikūṭa [peri-orbital swelling], śūnavadana [oedema of face], śītatā [cold], stimita [feeling as if wrapped with wet cloth], śirānispandatā [veins not pulsating], ahan manda rujāḥ [mild pain at daytime], niśi adhika rujāḥ [more pain at night], karṇa kaṇḍū [itching in ear], vami [vomiting], kaphōpadigdhaṁ [affected with kapha], pratiṣṭabdha-śiraḥ [stiffness of the head], hima-śiraḥ [head becomes cold]

the disorder is characterized by śūla [pain], bhramaḥ [giddiness or dizziness], kampaḥ [shaking of the head], dāhaḥ [burning sensation], madaḥ [intoxication], tr̥̄ṣā [thirst], gurutvaṁ [heaviness], tandrā [drowsiness/lassitude], sarvaistridōṣaṁ/sarvāṇi liṁgāni samudbhavanti/sarvalakṣaṇaḥ [all symptoms are seen/complete expression of disease symptoms]
the disorder is characterized by pittasamānaliṅgaḥ [blister having pitta dominant features], sparśāsahatva śirasaḥ [tenderness/inability to tolerate touch], pittādhikarujā [pitta predominant pain]

the disorder is characterized by vyadha [penetrating type of pain], chēda [cutting type of pain], rujā/ śiraḥarti [pain/headache], kaṇḍūḥ [itching], śōpha [oedema], duḥkhitam gati [diseased gait], krimi darśana [worm manifesatation], śiraḥdaurgandhya [foul smell from head], śiraḥtōda [pricking pain in head], atimātraṁ śiraḥnistudyatē [severe pricking type of pain in headache], saṁbhakṣyamāṇaṁ [pain as if being stung by insect], antaḥ sphuṭatīva [breaking pain from inside], antaḥ spuratīva [pulsating sensation from inside], salilaṁ saraktaṁ ghrāṇaḥ gacchēta [watery and blood stained rhinorrhoea], salilaṁ sapūyaṁ ghrāṇaḥ gacchēta [watery rhinorrhoea with pus], ghōra vēdanā [severe pain], citta vibhraṁśajananī [(pain which is )disturbing mind], jvaraḥ [fever], kāsaḥ [cough], bala kṣaya [loss of strength], raukṣya [dryness], dāhaḥ [burning sensation], sphuraṇa [pulsating sensation], pūtitā [putrid smell], kapāla kaṇḍūḥ [itching in forehead], tālu kaṇḍūḥ [itching in palate], śiraḥ kaṇḍūḥ [itching in head], śōṣa [dryness/wasting/emaciation], pramīlaka [shutting eyes], tāmra siṁghāṇaka [coppery nasal crust], accha siṁghāṇaka [clear nasal crust], karṇa nāda [tinnitus]

the disorder is characterized by manyā vēdanā [pain in neck], paścādghāṭā vēdanā [pain in nape of neck], vēdanā akṣi avatiṣṭhati [pain resides at eyes], vēdanā bhrū avatiṣṭhati [paoin resides at eyebrows], vēdanā śaṅkhēṣvavatiṣṭhati [pain resides at temporal region], gaṇḍapārśva spandanaṁ [pulsating sensation at zygomatic region], nētrarōgaḥ [eye diseases], hanugrahaḥ [lock jaw/catching sensation over jaw], manyāṁ sampīḍya [pain in neck], tīvra ghāṭā rujā [severe pain in the nape of neck], akṣi rujā [pain in eyes], bhrū rujā [pain in eyebrows], śaṁkhadēśē rujā [pain in temporal region], gaṇḍa-pārśva kampaḥ [pulsating sensation in zygomatic region], hanugrahaḥ [lock jaw/catching sensation over jaw], lōcana rōgaḥ [other eye diseases]

the disorder is characterized by tīvra śastranibhāṁ manyā ativēdanām [severe pain in neck like that by sharp weapon], tīvra araṇinibhāṁ manyā ātivēdanām [severe pain in neck like that of sting], tīvra śastranibhāṁ bhrū ativēdanām [severe pain in eyebrows like that by sharp weapon], tīvra araṇinibhāṁ bhrū ativēdanām [severe pain in eyebrows like that of sting], tīvra śastranibhāṁ śaṅkha ativēdanām [severe pain in temporal region like that by sharp weapon], tīvra araṇinibhāṁ śaṅkha ativēdanām [severe pain in temporal region like that of sting], tīvra śastranibhāṁ karṇa ativēdanām [severe pain in ear like that by sharp weapon], tīvra araṇinibhāṁ karṇa ativēdanām [severe pain in ear like that of sting], tīvra śastranibhāṁ akṣi ativēdanām [severe pain in eyes like that by sharp weapon], tīvra araṇinibhāṁ akṣi ativēdanām [severe pain in eyes like that of sting], tīvra śastranibhāṁ lalāṭārdhē ativēdanām [severe pain in half part of forehead like that by sharp weapon], tīvra araṇinibhāṁ lalāṭārdhē ativēdanām [severe pain in half part of forehead like that of sting], ativr̥ddhō nayanaṁ vināśayēt [(disease) if progressed very much, damages eye], ativr̥ddhō śrōtraṁ vināśayēt/ativr̥ddhō śravaṇaṁ vināśayēt [(disease) if progressed very much, damages ear], atīva uttamāṁgārdha sambhēdaḥ [severe breaking pain in upper part of the body/head], atīva uttamāṁgārdha tōdaḥ [severe pricking pain in upper part of the body/head], atīva uttamāṁgārdha bhrama [severe giddiness], atīva uttamāṁgārdha śūlaḥ [severe pain in head/upper part of the body], aksmāt uttamāṁgārdha śūlaḥ [sudden headache], pakṣād uttamāṁgārdha śūlaḥ/pakṣād kupyati [fortnightly headache arises], daśāhād uttamāṁgārdha śūlaḥ [headache arises about every 10 days], ardha mūrdhnaḥ śirastāpa [burning sensation in half part of the head], māsād kupyati [pain arises within a moth], svayamēva śāmyati [slef limiting pain]

the disorder is characterized by śiraḥśūlaṁ dinavr̥ddhyā vivardhatē [headache worsens as day progresses], dinakṣayē tataḥ styānē [reduces towards end of the day], sūryōdayaṁ mandamandaṁ akṣi ruk/ [mild pain in eyes at sunrise], sūryōdayaṁ mandamandaṁ bhrū ruk [mild pain in eyebrows at sunrise], gāḍhaṁ samupaiti [severe pain in eyes], vivardhatē aṁśumatā [(pain) worsens by sunlight], śītēna śāntiṁ labhatē [subsides by cold], kadāciduṣṇēna sukhamāpnuyāt [sometimes subsides by hot treatment], sūryōdayām śaṁkhaḥ saspandanām rujaḥ [pulsating pain in temporal region at sunrise], sūryōdayām akṣiḥ saspandanām rujaḥ [pulsating pain in eyes at sunrise], sūryōdayām bhrū saspandanām rujaḥ [pulsating pain in eyebrows at sunrise], sūryōdayām lalāṭa saspandanām rujaḥ [pulsating pain in forehead at sunrise], madhyāhanam vivardhiṣṇu [worsens at mid day], viśēṣataḥ kṣudvataḥ vivardhiṣṇu [pain worsens when patient is empty stomach], avyavasthita śītasukhā [uncertain comfort to cold], avyavasthita uṣṇasukhā [uncertain comfort to hot], śāmyatyataḥ param [pain subsides later (after sunset)], sūryāpavr̥ttau vinivartatē (akṣi-bhruruk) [pain subsides at the sunset]

the disorder is characterized by tīvraruk (śaṅkhadēśa)/tīvra śaṅkha rujā viśēṣataḥ [severe pain in temporal region], dāhaḥ (śaṅkhadēśa)/ tīvra dāha [burning sensation in temporal region], rāga (śaṅkhadēśa) [redness/congestion in temporal region], dāruṇa śōpha/ śaṁkha śōpha [hard swelling in temporal region], viṣavadvēgī [rapid progressing like poison], śiraḥ nirudhyāśu [immediately affects/blocks the head], galaḥ nirudhyāśu [quickly choaks the throat], trirātrāñjīvitaṁ hanti [takes away life within three days], tīvra mūrdhni rujā [severe headache], pralāpa [excess talking/irrelevant speech/incoherent speech], tīvra rujā [severe pain], jvaraḥ [fever], tr̥ḍ [thirst], bhramaḥ [giddiness or dizziness], tiktāsya [bitter taste in mouth], pītavadanaḥ [icteric face], kṣiprakārī [quick acting]
the disorder is characterized by kampaḥ [tremors]

the disorder is characterized by śirōḥ abhitāpa [buring sensation in head], atimātram ugrarujāḥ [excruating pain], rujāḥ saṁsvēdana vivr̥ddhi [pain increase by sudation], rujāḥ chardana vivr̥ddhi [pain increase by vomitting], rujāḥ dhūma vivr̥ddhi [pai increases by fomentation], rujāḥ nasya vivr̥ddhi [pai increases by nasal instillation of medicine], rujāḥ asr̥gvimōkṣa vivr̥ddhi [pain increases by blood letting]
the disorder is characterized by savarṇa śōpha [swelling which is same colour of the skin], nīrujaḥ śōphaḥ [painless swelling]

short_definition: premature graying of hair (due to pitta and other dōṣa)
long_definition: the disorder is characterized by śirōruhāṇām [of hairs], hariprabhatvam [like that of monkey], kēśa pacanam [greying of hairs]
the disorder is characterized by sphuṭitaṁ [split], śyāvaṁ [bluish black colour], kharaṁ [rough], rūkṣaṁ [dry], jalaprabham [resembling water], jvalat prabhaṁ [like that of flames]
the disorder is characterized by sadāhaṁ [associated with burning sensation], pītābhaṁ [yellowish discoloration]
the disorder is characterized by snigdhaṁ [scalp is unctuous], vivr̥ddhimat [hairs are growing], sthūlaṁ [broad], suśuklaṁ [white]
the disorder is characterized by miśralakṣaṇaṁ [with mixed symptoms]
the disorder is characterized by śirōrujōdbhavaṁ [greying caused by headache], vivarṇaṁ [discolouration], sparśanāsaham [tenderness/inability to tolerate touch]

the disorder is characterized by pracyāvayati rōmāṇi [(it makes) hairs to fall], ruṇaddhi rōmakūpāṁstu tatō~ऽnyēṣāmasambhavaḥ [obstructs hair roots, hence other hairs can't grow], kramāt śātanam [gradual hair fall]
the disorder is characterized by agnidagdhābhā [resembles as though burnt by fire]
the disorder is characterized by svinna/svēda [unctuousness], sirāvr̥ta [manifestation of veins on skin]
the disorder is characterized by ghana [thick], tvagvarṇā [same colour as of the skin]
the disorder is characterized by nakhaprabhā [resembles nail], agninēva dagdhaḥ [burnt by fire], nirlōma [hairless], dāhaḥ [burning sensation]

the disorder is characterized by kēśabhūmi-kaṇḍūram [itching of scalp], kēśacyuti [falling of hairs], kēśasvāpa [loss of tactile sensation], kēśabhūmi rukṣam [dryness of scalp], kēśabhūmi sphuṭanam/susūkṣmaṁ tvacā sphuṭanam [crack in the scalp], kēśabhūmi dāruṇam [hardening of scalp], kēśabhūmi prapāṭyatē [cracked scalp skin], rukṣa kēśa [dry hairs]

short_definition: eruptions on head having multiple openings/furunculosis
long_definition: the disorder is characterized by bahuvaktrāṇi mūrdhani arūṁṣi [dry scaly lesions having multiple openings in the head], bahuklēdīni mūrdhani arūṁṣi [moist leisons in scalp], kapālē klēdabahulāḥ piṭikāḥ [moist eruption in scalp region], piṭikā kaṁgunibhāḥ [papules/eruptions resembling kaṇgu], piṭikā siddhārthakanibhāḥ [papules/eruptions resembling siddhārthaka]
the disorder is characterized by arbuda [tumor]
the disorder is characterized by vidradhi [abscess]

the disorder is characterized by mukha śōṣa [dryness of mouth], mukha kārkaśya [excess dryness of face], mukha raukṣya [dryness of face], cala rujā [shifting pain], kr̥ṣṇa niṣpatanaṁ [black salivation], aruṇa niṣpatanaṁ [slightly reddish salivation], śīta niṣpatanaṁ [cold salivation], prasaṁsana (ōṣṭhaḥ) [loosening of lips], spandana (ōṣṭhaḥ) [pulsating sensation], tōda (ōṣṭhaḥ) [pricking pain in lips], bhēda (ōṣṭhaḥ) [cracked lip], karkaśauṣṭhaḥ [rough lips], paruṣauṣṭhaḥ [hard lips], stabdhauṣṭhaḥ [rigid lips], kr̥̄ṣṇauṣṭhaḥ [dark/blackish lips], tīvra rugānvitaḥ (ōṣṭhaḥ) [lips with severe pain], dālanam (dālyētē) [cracking of lips], paripāṭanam (paripāṭyatē) [fissuring of lips], mahārujā [severe pain], asita ōṣṭhaḥ [blackish lips]

the disorder is characterized by tr̥ṣṇā [thirst], jvaraḥ [fever], sphōṭaka [blisters], dāha piḍakā [nodule with burning sensation], pāka [inflammation/suppuration], dhūmāyana [smoky/fuming sensation], mūrcchā [syncope/attacks of swooning], vividha rujā [pain of various kind], avadīrṇatā [cracked nature], śukla varṇa varjyā [appearance of colours except white], aruṇa varṇa varjyā [appearance of colours except red], bhr̥śaṁ sarṣapa ākr̥ti piḍakā/sarṣapa ākr̥ti piḍakā [mustard like eruptions], nīla saṁsrāva [bluish discharge], pīta saṁsrāva [yellowish discharge], kaṇḍū (ōṣṭhaḥ) [itching in lips], savarṇa piḍakā [skin colorted nodule], avēdanā [painless], picchila (ōṣṭhaḥ) [slimeness of lip], śītala (ōṣṭhaḥ) [cold lips], guru (ōṣṭhaḥ) [heaviness of lips], tīkṣṇa (ōṣṭhaḥ) [sharp lips], asaha (ōṣṭhaḥ) [tender lips], pīta (ōṣṭhaḥ) [yellowish lips], bahuklēda (piḍakā) [moist eruptions/vesicles], āśupāka (piḍakā) [undergoes quick suppuration], sadāha piḍakā [vesicle with burning], sapāka piḍakā [vesicle with suppuration], pītābhā piḍakā [eruptions appear yellow], sarujā piḍakā [painful vesicle]

the disorder is characterized by kaṇḍūḥ [itching], guru (ōṣṭhaḥ) [heaviness of lips], sita (ōṣṭhaḥ) [whitish lip], vijjala (ōṣṭhaḥ) [moist], snēha (ōṣṭhaḥ) [unctuous lip], aruci [tastelessness], jāḍya (ōṣṭhaḥ) [rigidity of lips], kaphaprasēka [mucoid salivation], utklēśaḥ [nausea/provocation of dōṣa], manda analaḥ [less sharp digestive capacity], tandrā [confused state], manda rujā [mild pain], savarṇa piḍakā (ōṣṭhaḥ) [lesion similar to colour of lips], avēdanāyuta-piḍakā (ōṣṭhaḥ) [painless eruptions in lips], picchilauṣṭhaḥ [lips become slimy], śītalauṣṭhaḥ [lips become cold], ōṣṭhagurutā [heaviness of lips], śītāsahaḥ (ōṣṭhaḥ) [intolerant to cold], śūna (ōṣṭhaḥ) [oedematous lips]

the disorder is characterized by sarvāṇi rūpāṇi [clinical features of all types of dōṣa], sakr̥tkr̥ṣṇa (ōṣṭhaḥ) [occasionally black lesions], sakr̥tpīta (ōṣṭhaḥ) [occasionally yellow lesions], sakr̥tchvēta (ōṣṭhaḥ) [ocasionally whitish leison], anēkapiḍakā [mutiple nodules], anēkābhā (piḍakā) [nodules of various colors], durgandha srāva (piḍakā) [foul smelling discharge], picchila (piḍakā) [slimy nodule], akasmātamlāna (piḍakā) [suddenly dried nodule], saṁśūna (ōṣṭhaḥ) [oedematous lips], rujā (ōṣṭhaḥ) [painful lip], viṣama pāki (piḍakā) [nodule with invariable nature of ripening]

the disorder is characterized by kharjuraphalavarṇa piḍakā/kharjurasadr̥śaṁ [eruption resembling the colour of date palm fruit], arbudaṁ kṣīṇē raktē [tumor after the blood is shed], rudhiraṁ upasr̥ṣṭaḥ [lips obscured with blood], śōṇitaprabhā sravataḥ [bleeding], nipīḍita-piḍakā [vesicles become painful], -srāvaḥ [secretion resembling blood]

the disorder is characterized by ōṣṭhagurutā [heaviness of lips], sthūlauṣṭhaḥ [thickening of lips], māṁsapiṇḍavadudgatauṣṭhaḥ/māṁsapiṇḍōpamama [projection of lips like a fleshy lump], mukhād sr̥kkasyōbhayatō jantavaḥ mūrcchanti [maggots coming from both coeners of mouth], kramāt kr̥mi mūrcchana [gradual elimination of kr̥mi (worms)], jantu-nirgamanam (jantavaścātra mūrcchanti) [maggots appears from both angles of mouth]

the disorder is characterized by sarpirmaṇḍapratīkāśauṣṭhaḥ/ghr̥tamaṇḍābhā [lips resembling the supernatent layer of ghee], kaṇḍūyutauṣṭhaḥ/kaṇḍūmanta (ōṣṭha) [itching sensation in lips], sthira (ōṣṭha) [stable nature of lip leison], mr̥du (ōṣṭha) [soft lips], bhr̥śaṁ accha sphaṭikasaṁkāśa srāvaḥ/accha sphaṭikasaṁkāśaṁ srāvaṁ [crystal clear discharge], guru (ōṣṭha) [heaviness of lips], tailābha (ōṣṭha) [unctuous lip], śvayathu (ōṣṭha) [oedematous lips], klēda (ōṣṭha) [moistening /soddening of lips], na saṁrōhanam vraṇaḥ [non healing ulcer], na mr̥dutva vraṇaḥ [non-softning of ulcer]

the disorder is characterized by kṣatajābhā [traumatic nature], ōṣṭha vidāraṇam (vidīryētē) [cracking of lips], ōṣṭha pāṭanam (pāṭyētē ) [fissuring of lips], grathitauṣṭhaḥ [nodular swelling of lips], kaṇḍūsamanvitauṣṭhaḥ [lips associated itching], avadīryatē (ōṣṭha) [cracked lip], daśanacchad (ōṣṭha) [lip (which covers teeth)]
the disorder is characterized by dvidhā [harelip/cleft lip]
the disorder is characterized by jalabudbudavat [resembles as water bubbles]

the disorder is characterized by dantavēṣṭēbhyaḥ akasmāt raktasrāvaḥ/dantavēṣṭēbhyaḥ akasmāt śōṇitasrāvaḥ [sudeen bleeding from gums], vahantyasramahētukam [bleeding without any cause], durgandha dantamāṁsaḥ [bad odour of gums], kr̥ṣṇa dantamāṁsaḥ [blackiness of gums], praklēda dantamāṁsaḥ/ klinna dantamāṁsaḥ [soddening of gums], mr̥du dantamāṁsaḥ [softening of gums], dantamāṁsa śīryantē [decaying of gums], dantamāṁsa pacanam (parasparam) [supporation of gums], asita dantamāṁsaḥ [blackish gums]

the disorder is characterized by dantayōstriṣu vā mahān śvayathuḥ [large swelling around two or three teeth], dantayōstriṣu vā mahān rujā [pain in two or three teeth], dantayōstriṣu vā mahān badarāsthinibhō śōphaḥ [huge swelling in two or three teeth], dantayōstriṣu vā mahān ghana śōphaḥ [large hard swelling around two or three teeth], tīvra ruk [severe pain], śīghra pacan [quick ripening]
the disorder is characterized by rudhira-srāvaḥ [bleeding/haemorrhage], pūyasrāvaḥ [pus discharge], cala dantaḥ [tooth moving in socket]
the disorder is characterized by dantamūla śvayathuḥ [swelling of root of teeth], rujāvān [painful teeth], lālāsrāvaḥ [excessive salivation], kaṇḍūmāna [itching sensation]

the disorder is characterized by danta calanam [loosening of teeth], dantavēṣṭāvadāraṇam [fissuring of the gums], tālvavadāraṇam [fissuring of the palate], mukha paripīḍan [affecting the mouth], danta māṁsa pacan [affecting the gums], jvaraḥ [fever], pūya srutiḥ [pus discharge], rudhir srutiḥ [haemorrhage], viśīrṇadvijabandhanaḥ [damaged socket of tooth]
the disorder is characterized by dantamāṁsa śīryantē [decaying of gums], asr̥k-ṣṭhīvanam [spitting of blood]

the disorder is characterized by śōphaḥ [oedema], lōhitadr̥k/ lōhitanētram [redness of eyes], nīladr̥k [bluish discolortion of eyes], śyāvanētram [blackish discoloration of eyes], dāhaḥ [burning sensation of eyes], pākaḥ [inflammation/suppuration], aśruḥ [tear secretion], bhr̥śaṁ āviladarśanam [sudden onset of blurred vision]

the disorder is characterized by avēdanaḥ [painless], savēdanaḥ [associated with pain], tāmrākṣirājyaḥ [coppery coloured lines], muhuḥ virāgaḥ [frequent discoloration], raktarājītataḥ [covered with red streaks], ūṣā [burning sensation with sweating and restlessness], vēdanā [pain], aśōphaḥ [absence of swelling], aśrurahitaḥ [absence of excessive tear secretion], upadēharahitaḥ [absence of excessive secretion of rheum]

the disorder is characterized by pragāḍhatāmrābha-asra-srāvaḥ [thick coppery coloured tears], pragāḍha-accha-asra-srāvaḥ [thick clear tears], abhivīkṣaṇāśaktiḥ/vīkṣaṇākṣamaḥ [difficulty in vision], rājī vardhatē [increased vascularity (than sirotpAta)]

the disorder is characterized by śōphaḥ [oedema], saṁrambhaḥ [redness/congesion/inflammation], kaluṣāśrutā [turbid eyes], kaphōpadigdha asitamaṇḍalam [cornea appears covered with kapha], praklēdayukta-śuklamaṇḍalam [excessive moistness of sclera], dāhaḥ [burning sensation], darśanasaṁrōdhaḥ [impairment of vision], anavasthitavēdanā [pain moving from one place to another], śvēta-samākrāmati sarvataḥ [whitish opacity covers the whole of the cornea]

short_definition: partial or total blindness/amaurosis/ametropia/partial obstruction of vision
long_definition: the disorder is characterized by abhūtadarśana [seeing unexisted things], bhrājiṣṇurūpadarśana [capable of visualising dazzling objects], dūrāntikastha darśana [near appearance,remote objects], hrasvadarśana [objects,mixed form or confused form]
the disorder is characterized by avyakta-rūpa-darśanam/rūpam avyaktamīkṣatē [blurring vision], animittataḥ vyaktaṁ api īkṣatē [intermittent spontaneous clear vision]

the disorder is characterized by dr̥ṣṭirbhr̥śaṁ vihvalati [severe impaired vision], makṣikā-darśanam [pseudovisulization of files], maśaka-darśanam [pseudovisualization of mosquitoes], kēśa-darśanam [pseudovisualization of hairs], jālaka-darśanam [pseudovisualization of webs], maṇḍala-darśanam [visualization pseudo of circles], patākā-darśanam [pseudovisualization of flags], marīcī-darśanam [pseudovisulization of mirages], kuṇḍala-darśanam [visualization pseudo of earrings], vividha-pariplava-darśanam [seeing of various moving celestial objects], varṣamabhra-darśanam [visulization of rain and cloud], tamō darśanam [seeing darkness], dūrasthāni rūpāṇi samīpataḥ manyatē/dūrasthaṁ rūpaṁ viparyāsēna manyatē [the distance object appears to be nearer], samīpasthāni dūrē manyatē/antikasthaṁ rūpaṁ viparyāsēna manyatē [the near object appears to be far], atyarthaṁ yatnavānapi sūcīpāśaṁ na paśyati [unable to locate the eye of the needle even with great efforts], abhūtamapi paśyati [visulazation of nonexistant things], bhūtaṁ yatnēna āsannaṁ vā paśyati [sees existant objects with difficulty by going close to them], dūraṁ sūkṣmaṁ na iṣyatē [cannot see distant or minute objects]
the disorder is characterized by samīpastha-rūpādarśanam [non visualization of near object]
the disorder is characterized by pārśvasthāni na paśyati [side vision is affected]
the disorder is characterized by saṅkulānīva paśyati [objects appear overlapping]

short_definition: diplopia along with mis-judgement of dimension
long_definition: the disorder is characterized by dvidhādarśanam [double vision]
the disorder is characterized by tridhā paśyati [images appear three in number]
the disorder is characterized by bahudhā-darśanam [object appears multiples]
the disorder is characterized by dūrastha-rūpādarśanam [non visualization of far object]
the disorder is characterized by ēkaṁ manyatē dvidhā [double vision]

the disorder is characterized by rūpāṇi bhramantīva paśyati [seeing of objects as if they are moving], āvilarūpadarśanam [objects are seen hazy], aruṇābhāṇāṁ rūpāṇāṁ darśanam [objects are seen slightly reddish], vyāviddha darśanam/vyāviddha iva paśyati [objects are seen tortous], calarūpadarśanam [visualization of moving objects], muhuḥ prasannaṁ ca īkṣatē [frequent clear vision], jāladarśanam [pseudovisualization of webs], kēśa-darśanam [pseudovisualization of hairs], maśaka-darśanam [pseudovisualization of mosquitoes], raśmī-darśanam [pseudovisualization of rays]

the disorder is characterized by āditya-darśanam [seeing the flashes of sun], khadyōta-darśanam/khadyōtadyōtadarśanam [seeing the glow worm], śakracāpa-darśanam [seeing rainbow], taḍidguṇa-darśanam/vidyut darśanam [seeing of flashing of lightening], śikhibarhavicitranīlakr̥ṣṇarūpadarśanam/ prāyaḥ śikhitittirapatrābhanīlaṁ paśyati [sees objects in the colour of feather of peacock], nr̥tyataḥ śikhina iva sarvaṁ nīlaṁ paśyati [seeing everything blue like dancing peacock]

the disorder is characterized by snigdha-rūpa-darśanam [seeing the objects as glossy], sita-rūpa-darśanam/śvētaṁ paśyati [seeing the objects as white], gauracāmaravat gaura-rūpa-darśanam [seeing the object like whitish yolk tail], śvētābhrapratima-rūpa-darśanam [seeing object as whitish cloud], atyartham asūkṣmāṇi paśyati [seeing excessively big objects only], vyabhrē abhrasaṁplava-darśanam [visualizing clouds in cloudy sky], salilaplāvitānīva parijāḍya-rūpa-darśanam [object appear as inundated in water], śaṁkha iva ācitaṁ paśyati [pupil appears as if filled with appearance of conch], indu-iva ācitaṁ paśyati [pupil appears as if filled with appearance of moon], kundakusuma-iva ācitaṁ paśyati [pupil appears as if filled with appearance of jasmine flower], kumuda-iva ācitaṁ paśyati [pupil appears as if filled with appearance of white lotus]

the disorder is characterized by citrāṇi paśyati [seeing object as of variegated colour], viplutānīva paśyati [seeing object as if disfigured], bahudhā darśanam [object appears mutiples], dvidhā-darśanam [double vision], sarvāṇyēva samantataḥ darśanam [seeing of images all around], hīnāṅgāni paśyati [body parts appear to be less], adhikāṅgāni paśyati [body parts appear to be more], jyōtīṁṣi paśyati [sees bright objects like stars], saṁkīrṇalakṣaṇān [mixed symptoms], akasmāt vyakta-īkṣaṇam [sudden clear vision], akasmāt ākulēkṣaṇam [sudden unclear vision]

the disorder is characterized by rakta-rūpa-darśanam [visualizing red object], vividha-tamōrūpa-darśanam/tamōbhūtaṁ paśyati [visualization of darkness], harita-rūpa-darśanam [visualization of greenish objects], śyāva-rūpa-darśanam [visualization of blackish objects], kr̥ṣṇa-rūpa-darśanam [visualization of black coloured objects], dhūmadhūmrāṇi īkṣatē [objects are seen as if through smoke], sita-rūpasya kr̥ṣṇārūpaṁpītarūpaṁ vā darśanam [white objects appear black or yellow]

the disorder is characterized by ūrdhvam īkṣatē [presence of vision in upward direction], adhaḥ na īkṣatē [absence of vision in downward direction], tanucailāvr̥tōpamadarśanam [seeing objects covered by nice cloth], yathāvarṇarañjanam [eyes appear in the colour of the respective dōṣa], kramāt dr̥ṣṭiḥ hīyatē [gradual decrease in vision], darśana aśakti [impariment of vision]

the disorder is characterized by ūrdhvam paśyati/ūrdhvam īkṣatē [presence of vision in upward direction], adhaḥ na paśyati/adhaḥ na īkṣatē [absence of vision in downward direction], mahān rūpāṇi api vāsasā chāditāni iva paśyati/tanucailāvr̥tōpamadarśanam/mahāntyapi rūpāṇi ambaraiḥ chāditāni iva paśyati [even large objects appear as if covered with a cloth], karṇanāsākṣiyuktāni viparītāni (hīnāni) vīkṣatē/karṇanāsākṣihīnāni vikr̥tānīva paśyati [face seems to be appear with the absence of ,ear,nose and eye], yathādōṣarañjanam/ yathāvarṇarañjanam [dr̥ṣṭi having colour as per the afflicting dōṣa], hīnāṅgadarśana [sees body parts as deficient (eg. face without nose etc.)]

the disorder is characterized by dr̥k aruṇaḥ paśyati [dr̥ṣṭi appear reddish in colour], paśyati āsyaṁ anāsikam [visualisation of face without nose], candradīpādi anēkaṁ paśyati [visualisation of moon, lights etc as multiple], vakraṁ r̥ju manyatē [visualisation of curved objects as straight], aruṇa-dr̥ṣṭimaṇḍalam [dristimandala becomes red], sthūlakācāruṇaprabham (dr̥ṣṭimaṇḍalam) [dristimandala appears like thick shining red glass]

the disorder is characterized by kācanīlābhadr̥k [bluish coloration of dr̥ṣṭi], kācanīlābhadarśanam [visualisation of objects as blue in colour], arkaparivēṣaḥ paśyati [visualisation of halo around the sun], induparivēṣaḥ paśyati [visualisation of halo around the moon], agniḥ paśyati [pseudovisualisation of fiery objects], marīcayaḥ paśyati [pseudovisualisation of mirages], indradhanūṁṣi paśyati [pseudovisualisation of rainbows], nīlarāgaḥ [lense is ascribed as blue], mlāyī-rāgaḥ [lense appears yellow]

the disorder is characterized by niṣprabhaḥ [having no lustre], indu iva ācitam [pupil appears as if filled with appearance of moon], arka iva ācitam [pupil appears as if filled with appearance of sun], pradīpa-iva ācitam [pupil appears as if filled with appearance of burning lamp], sitābha-dr̥ṣṭiḥ [whitish discoloration of dr̥ṣṭi], sita-rāgaḥ [lens is ascribed as white]
the disorder is characterized by dr̥ṣṭau citra-rāgaḥ [lens is ascribed of variegated colour]

the disorder is characterized by raktadr̥ṣṭiḥ [reddish discoloration of dr̥ṣṭi], kr̥ṣṇadr̥ṣṭiḥ [blackish discoloration of dr̥ṣṭi], raktaṁ paśyati [sees everything as red in colour], kr̥ṣṇaṁ paśyati [sees everything as black in colour], sarakta- rāgaḥ [lense is ascribed as blood-red]

the disorder is characterized by candrādityanakṣatravidyutādi bhrājiṣṇūni nirmalāni tējāṁsi paśyati [seeing objects glowing], dr̥ṣṭirōdhaḥ [impariment of vision], bhramanti iva [objects looks as dazzling], jyōtiṣa iva darśana [seeing star like objects], taḍitkuṇa [seeing lightning before eyes]

the disorder is characterized by nakṣatra--darśanam [capable of seeing the stars], nirmala-tējāṁsi paśyati [capable of seeing clear and bright object], sarvatō dr̥ṣṭirōdhaḥ [all around obstruction of vision], candrādityadarśanam [capable of seeing the moon, the sun], antarīkṣē vidyutaḥ darśanam [capable of seeing lightening in the sky], bhrājiṣṇu-darśanam [capable of visualising dazzling objects], dr̥ṣṭimaṇḍalacchādanam [obstruction of vision]

the disorder is characterized by aruṇa-maṇḍalam [the mandala appears reddish], cañcala-maṇḍalam [the mandala becomes unstable], paruṣa-maṇḍalam [irregular-manḍala], rajōdhūmāvr̥tamiva dr̥ṣṭiḥ [unclear vision as if through dust and smoke], spaṣṭāruṇābhadr̥ṣṭiḥ [clear reddish discoloration of dr̥ṣṭi], vistīrṇadr̥ṣṭiḥ [enlarged pupil], sūkṣmadr̥ṣṭiḥ [small sized pupil], hatadarśanam [loss of vision]

the disorder is characterized by ānīlamaṇḍalam [bluish discoloration of maṇḍala], kāṁsyābhamaṇḍalam [coppery discoloration of maṇḍala], pītamaṇḍalam [yellowish disclolortion of maṇḍala], bhr̥ṁganīlā dr̥k [pupils appear bluish black colour similar to that of bee], nirālōkaḥ [loss of vision], snigdhadr̥k [eyes apperas unctuous], niṣṭīva [spitting], prasēkaḥ [excessive salivation], rujā [pain], sparśāsahatvam [tenderness/inability to tolerate touch]

the disorder is characterized by bahalaḥ [large in size], snigdhaḥ [smooth/unctuous /oily], śaṅkhapāṇḍuram/śaṅkhaśuklimā [offwhite colour similar to conchshell], kundapāṇḍuram/kundaśuklimā [colour similar to that of jasmine flower], indupāṇḍuram/induśuklimā [colour similar to that of the moon], mr̥dyamānē nayanē maṇḍalasya visarpaṇam [mandala becomes wide when the eyes are rubbed], darśananāśanam [loss of vision], calatpadmapalāśasthaḥ śuklō bindurivāmbhasaḥ/padminīpuṭasaṁsthitajalabindu iva calaḥ [mandala appears like a shining drop of water on a moving leaf of lotus], ātapē atyarthaṁ saṁkucati/uṣṇē saṁkōcamāyāti [pupil constricts on sunlight], chāyāyāṁ vistr̥taḥ bhavēt/chāyāyāṁ parisarpati [pupil dialates in shade], kumudaśuklimā [whitish colour similar to that of lotus], sphaṭikōpamaśuklimā [whitish colour similar to that of quartz crystal]

the disorder is characterized by pravālābhaḥ [pearl colour], padmapatrābhaḥ [colour, red lotus petal], kr̥ṣṇadr̥k [blackish discoloration of dr̥ṣṭi], niṣprabhaḥ [lustreless eyes], hatadarśanaḥ [loss of vision], raktadr̥k [red coloured vision]
the disorder is characterized by citrarāgaḥ [multi colour]

the disorder is characterized by diśaḥ pītaṁ paśyati [sees all directions as yellow], diśaḥ udayantaṁ āditya iva paśyati [seeing rising sun before eyes], tējōbhiḥ khadyōtaiḥ vikīryamāṇān iva vr̥kṣān paśyati [sees trees as if scattered with numerous shining fireflies], analaprabha [colour,glowing fire], ānīla [lightblue], maṇḍala [circular lesion], mlāyinīladarśana [yellowish blue circular patch appear before eyes], pītadarśana [seeing objects, yellow colour], tējōbhi iva [seeing objects as fire]
the disorder is characterized by dr̥ṣṭividīraṇam [crack], dr̥ṣṭisādaḥ [weakness of eyes], dr̥ṣṭihāniḥ [loss of vision], glāni [fatigue in mind and body]

short_definition: vision(lens) is unsteady and slightly red or black in color
long_definition: the disorder is characterized by āvartacaladr̥ṣṭiḥ [encircled with unsteady], aruṇadr̥ṣṭiḥ [objects look like slightly red coloured], asitadr̥ṣṭiḥ [blackish discoloration of dr̥ṣṭi], śīta [white coloured]

short_definition: appearance of white lines in lens
long_definition: the disorder is characterized by arkapayōlēśanicita iva atighanaḥ [lens appears as if smeared with threads of milky sap of arka and is thick /thin], kūrcikāpiṇḍēna iva ācitaḥ [lens appears as if smeared with inspissated milk]

short_definition: appearance of grains in lens-vision(lens) appears as studded by spikes of paddy grains
long_definition: the disorder is characterized by śāliśūkābharājibhiḥ nicitaḥ [lens appears similar to awns of grains], abhīkṣṇa-chardi [frequent vomiting], atibaddha ucchvasah [severe restricted expiration], bahala [large in size], bhaṅga [breakingpain], bhagna [breaking pain], gaurava [heaviness], ghurghuraka [making ghurghur sound], harśa [horripilation], kaṇḍūḥ [itching], pāṇḍu [pallor/pale], śōpha [oedema], śukla [white colour], srāva [watery nose], tamaḥpravēśa [feels as entering into darkness]

short_definition: Appearance of white lines in lens-vision(lens) is uneven(irregular) torn(discontented) and burnt like and is painful
long_definition: the disorder is characterized by viṣamaḥ [irregular/uneven], chinnaḥ [splitted], dagdhābhaḥ [burnt apperance], rujā [pain]

short_definition: vision(lens) resembles the bell metal colour and moon like appearance.
long_definition: the disorder is characterized by kāṁsyasamacchāyā [coppery hue], candrakākr̥tiḥ [moon shaped]
the disorder is characterized by chatrābhaḥ [umbrella shaped], naikavarṇaḥ/citrarāgaḥ [multi colour], nīlikā [blackish patch on any part of the body]

the disorder is characterized by dr̥ṣṭiḥ pītā bhavēt [yellowish discoloration of eyes], rūpāṇi pītāni manyatē [sees objects as yellow], divā na paśyēt [day blindness], niśi vīkṣatē [normal vision during night], arkē astamastakanyastakagabhastau sthaganam [loss of vision after sunset]

the disorder is characterized by rūpāṇi śuklāni manyatē [patients percepts all objects as white.], naktāndhyam [night blindness], divā rūpāṇi īkṣēta [during the day eyes are favoured by the sun and the patient can see objects]

short_definition: blindness due to excess intake of vidāhī food
long_definition: the disorder is characterized by dāhaḥ [burning sensation all over body], ūṣā [burning sensation with sweating and restlessness], malinaṁ śuklam [sclera appear dirty], ahani āviladarśanam [unclear vision during daytime], rātryāndhyam [night blindness]
the disorder is characterized by sarvabhāvān sadhūmakān paśyati/dhūmadr̥k [seeing eveything covered with smoke], dhūmāviladr̥ṣṭiḥ [eyes appear dirty with cloudy appearance]
the disorder is characterized by divasēṣu kr̥cchrāt-hr̥sva-rūpa-darśanam/hrasvadarśanam [seeing object as small with great difficulties in day time], hrasvasaṁsthānaḥ [pupils appear small]

the disorder is characterized by dr̥ṣṭiḥ nakulavat vidyōtatē [eyes shines like that of mangoose], divā citra-rūpa-darśanam/ahni citraṁ paśyati [seeing object with variegated colour in day time], niśi citraṁ na paśyati [absence of seeing of objects in variegated colour during night]

the disorder is characterized by virūpa-dr̥ṣṭiḥ [defomed eyes], abhyantarasaṁkucita-dr̥ṣṭiḥ/dr̥gmaṇḍalam antaḥ praviśati [eyes shrink inwards], avagāḍha-rujā [intense pain], dr̥k-sirāsaṁkōcaḥ [constriction of vessels of eye]
the disorder is characterized by klēdaḥ [moistening /soddening], kaṇḍūḥ [itching], kaluṣadr̥ṣṭiḥ [dirtiness]
the disorder is characterized by abhiṣyandanidarśanaḥ [features of abhiṣyanda]

the disorder is characterized by dr̥ṣṭihananam [blindness], vispaṣṭadr̥ṣṭiḥ [unclear vision], vaiḍūryavarṇadr̥ṣṭiḥ [colour of eye similar to cat's eye gem], vimaladr̥ṣṭiḥ/prakr̥tisthamivāvyathadr̥ṣṭiḥ [occasional normal vision], stimitadr̥ṣṭiḥ [fixed gaze], darśana aśakti [impariment of vision], visarpaiva avabhati [looking bright]

the disorder is characterized by vibandha [fullness of ,abdomen due to constipation], śiraśūla [headache], gauravaḥ [heaviness of the body], ghrāṇaviplavaḥ [stuffy nose], jvaraḥ [fever], kāsaḥ [cough], kaphōtklēśaḥ [nausea with mucous], svarabhēdaḥ [hoarseness of voice]

the disorder is characterized by śirōgurutvaṁ [heaviness of head], kṣavathu/kṣava pravr̥tti [sneezing], aṅgamardaḥ [generalised bodyache], parihr̥ṣṭarōmatā [horripilation], śirasō atipūrṇatā [feeling of fullness of head], stambhaḥ [rigidity/stiffness]

the disorder is characterized by nāsā-praklidyatē/nāsikā klēda [moistening of nose], nāsā-pariśuṣyati/nāsikā saṁśōṣa [dryness in nose], nāsā-punarānahyatē [intermittent nasal blockage], nāsā-punarvivriyatē [intermittent clearing of nose], atidurgandha-niḥśvāsaḥ/atidurgandha ucchvāsa [bad breath], gandhān na vētti [unable to perceive smell], sarvēndriya tāpanam [afflicts all sensory organs], agnisādaḥ [diminution of agni (digestive power)], jvaraḥ [fever], śvāsaḥ [breathlessness/difficult breathing], kāsaḥ [cough], urōvēdanam [pain in the chest region], pārśvavēdanā [pain in sides of chest/flanks], akasmāt bahuśō kupyati [intermittent relapses without apparent reason], mukha daurgandhya [halitosis], śōphakr̥ta [odema], nāsikā śuddhi rōdhakarō muhuḥ [intermittent clearing and obstruction of nose], pūyōpamā grathita ślēṣma saṁsruti [discharge of thickened mucus resembling pus], asita rakta grathita ślēṣma saṁsruti [blackish or reddish tinged thick mucus discharge], dīrghāḥ kr̥mayōḥ atra mūrcchanti [manifestation of long thread like worms], snigdhaḥ kr̥mayōḥ atra mūrcchanti [manifestation of unctuous appearing worms], śvētāḥkr̥mayōḥ atra mūrcchanti [manifestation of whitish worms], aṇavaḥ kr̥mayōḥ atra mūrcchanti [manifestation of minute worms]

the disorder is characterized by ānaddhā nāsā/ ghrāṇa uparōdhaḥ [fullness or blocking of nose], pihitā nāsā [feeling as if nose is filled with dust etc], tanusrāvaḥ [thin watery discharge], gala-śōṣaḥ [dryness of throat], tālu-śōṣaḥ [dryness of palate], ōṣṭhaśōṣaḥ [dryness of lips], śaṅkha-nistōdaḥ [pricking pain in temples], kṣavapravr̥ttiratyartham/bhr̥śaṁ kṣavaḥ [excessive sneezing tendency], vaktravairasyam [tastelessness of mouth], svarōpaghātaḥ/ svarasādaḥ [hoarseness of voice/weakness of voice], danta vyathā [toothache], śaṁkha vyathā [distress in temporal region (pain)], śirō vyathā [distress in the head (pain)], bhrūvau kīṭikā sarpantiriva manyatē [feeling as if insects are crawling in the supraorbital area], cirāt pākaḥ [take a long time to suppurate], śiśira kapha sruti [discharge of cold mucus], acch kapha sruti [discharge of clear mucus]

the disorder is characterized by uṣṇaḥ srāvō ghrāṇāt [warm and yellowish discharge through nose], sapītakaḥ srāvō ghrāṇāt/pīta kaphasruti [yellowish discharge from nose], kr̥śaḥ [emaciated/thin /malnourished], atipāṇḍuḥ [excessive paleness of body], santāpaḥ [burning sensation], tr̥ṣṇāni(bhi)pīḍitaḥ [excessive thirst], sadhūmaṁ sahasā vahniṁ vamatīva ca nāsāyā mānavaḥ [feeling as if he would suddenly vomit out a mass of fire with fumes], ghrāṇapiṭikā sambhava [manifestation of eruptions inside nose], bhramaḥ [giddiness or dizziness], nāsāgra pāka [suppuration of nose tip], jvaraḥ [fever], rūkṣa kaphasruti [discharge of dried mucus], uṣṇaḥkaphasruti [discharge of hot mucus], tāmra kaphasruti [coppery coloured nasal discharge]

the disorder is characterized by muhuḥśīta-kaphasrāvaḥ(ghrāṇāt) [cold copius mucous dischage from nose], muhuḥśukla-kaphasrāvaḥ(ghrāṇāt) [intermittent discharge of white mucus], śuklāvabhāsaḥ [whitish appearence of the body], śuklākṣa [whitish colored eyes], śirō-gauravaḥ [heaviness of head], kaṇṭha atīva kaṇḍūḥ [excessive itching in throat], tālu-atīvakaṇḍūḥ [excessive itching in palate], ōṣṭha-atīvakaṇḍūḥ [excessive itching in lips], śiraḥatīva-kaṇḍūḥ [excessive itching in head], kāsaḥ [cough], aruci [tastelessness], vamathu [vomiting], gātragaurava [heaviness of body parts], vadana mādhuryam [sweet taste in mouth], snigdha kapha sruti [unctuous mucus discharge], śūnākṣa [swelling in orbital region]

the disorder is characterized by aṅgalāghavaṁ [feeling of lightness in the body], kṣavathōḥ śamaḥ [subsiding of sneezing], ślēṣmā sacikkaṇaḥ [nasal discharge become slimy and sticky], ślēṣmā pītō [yellowish discharge], ajñānaṁ ca rasagandhayōḥ [inability to understand taste and smell]

the disorder is characterized by ghōra dēhakarśanaḥ [severe emaciation of the body], śiraḥśūlaṁ [headache], gauravam [heaviness], ghrāṇaviplavaḥ [stuffy nose], jvaraḥ [fever], kāsaḥ [cough], kaphōtklēśaḥ [nausea with mucous], svarabhēda [hoarseness of voice], āruciḥ [tastelessness], klamaḥ [exhaustion without exertion], indriyāṇāmasāmarthyaṁ [inability of sensory and motor organs to perform their activities]

short_definition: worm/parasite arise from kapha and blood

the disorder is characterized by nīlimā [bluish tinge], pīta [yellowish], dāhaḥ [burning sensation]

short_definition: painless greengram like papules in children
long_definition: the disorder is characterized by grathita piṭikā [hard nodular/papular lesions], nīruja piṭikā [painless nodule], mudga sannibhaḥpiṭikā [nodule of the size of green gram], tvaka savarṇa piṭikā [skin coloured nodule], snigdha piṭikā [waxy/ unctuous lesion]

the disorder is characterized by alpa saṁrambha piṭikā [less inflammed nodules], gambhīra piṭikā [deep routed lesion], antaḥ prapākaḥ [lesion with tendency to suppurate internally], tvak savarṇa piṭikā [skin coloured nodule], uparisthitāḥ (mastakōpari) piṭikā [located in scalp/ head]

the disorder is characterized by alpa pūya yukta piḍakā [Lesion with small amount of pus or with less tendency to suppurate], avaktra piḍakā [lesion without punctum], unnata parimaṇḍala piḍakā [raised circular lesion], ghana piḍakā [thick and firm lesion], āma udumbara saṁkāśa piḍakā [lesion resembling unripe fig fruit]
the disorder is characterized by avpāṭyatē carmaḥ (mēḍhrē) [fissuring or cracking of skin of prepuce]

the disorder is characterized by pāda aṅgulyantarā rujā [pain in the interdigital areas of feet], pāda aṅgulyantarā kaṇḍu [itching in the interdigital areas of feet], pāda aṅgulyantarā klēdaḥ/klinnatā [sticky moistness of interdigital areas of feet], pāda aṅgulyāntarā dāhaḥ [burning sensation of interdigital areas of feet]

short_definition: eruptions on head having multiple openings/furunculosis
long_definition: the disorder is characterized by klēda bahula piṭikāḥ(kapālē)/ bahu klēdīni [wet papules on scalp], kapālē bahuvaktrāṇi piṭikā [scalp lesions with multiple openings], siddhārthanibha piṭikā [lesion resembling the size and shape and colour of mustard seed], kaṅgunibha piṭikā [lesion resembling the size and shape of jyotishmati seeds (celastrus paniculata)]
the disorder is characterized by padmakarṇikavat/(padmapuṣkaravat) madhyē piṭikā [numerous papular lesions conglomerated to give the appearance of lotus flower thalamus]
the disorder is characterized by kōṭhaḥ sānubandhastu utkōṭhaḥ [kōtha that recur again and again]
the disorder is characterized by rāgavanti maṇḍalaḥ [reddish circular rash], bahūni maṇḍalaḥ [multiple circular lesions or rashes], atikaṇḍū maṇḍalaḥ [lesions associated with excessive itching]
ontology_branches: Note: Also Classifed under śōṇitajanyarōgaḥ[ED-2] and raktavahasrōtōvikāra [ED]

short_definition: circular eruptions on neck and head due to three dōṣa
long_definition: the disorder is characterized by jvarānvita piṭikā [occurrence of lesion associated with fever], uttamāṅgastu/jatrūrdhva piṭikā [papularlesion that occur in supra-clavicular region], vr̥tta piṭikā [circular lesion], ugrarujā piṭikā [papular lesion associated with severe pain]

the disorder is characterized by bāhupradēśē sphōṭāḥ [vesicular lesions in upper arm], pārśvēṣu sphōṭāḥ [vesicular lesions in and around flanks], kakṣāsannēṣu/ kakṣē sphōṭāḥ [vesicular lesions in peri-axillar regions], aṁsa dēśē sphōṭāḥ [vesicular lesions in shoulder], kr̥ṣṇa sphōṭāḥ [black coloured vesicular lesions], savēdanā sphōṭāḥ [painful vesicles], sūkṣmā piṭikā [minute papular/vesicular lesions], lājōpamā piṭikā [lesions that appear like laajaa (parched paddy)], ghana piṭikā [lesions that are thick and dense]
the disorder is characterized by grathitaḥ śōthaḥ [hard nodular swelling], kacchapōnnata(śōthaḥ) [tortoise shell like swelling which is elevated in the middle], pañca/ṣaṭ [5 or 6 in number]
the disorder is characterized by kōlavat utsanna granthi [swelling resembling the size and shape of indian jujube (kōla)], kīlavat utsanna granthiḥ [swelling that appear like nail]
the disorder is characterized by khara nakha [rough appearance and texture of nails], asita nakha [blackish coloured nails], rūkṣa nakha [dry nails]

the disorder is characterized by sphōṭa sannibhaḥ piṭikā [lesion resembling vesicles], ēkaṁ [one in number], bāhu dēśē sphōṭa sannibhaḥ ēka piṭikā [single vesicular lesion in upper arm], aṁsa dēśē sphōṭa sannibhaḥ ēka piṭikā [single vesicular lesion in the shoulder region], pārśva dēśē sphōṭa sannibhaḥ ēka piṭikā [single vesicular lesion in the flanks], kakṣā dēśē sphōṭa sannibhaḥ ēka piṭikā [single vesicular lesion in the axillary region], mahatī piṭikā [large vesicular swelling], lāja sadr̥śa piṭikā [vesicle/lesions resembling parched paddy]

the disorder is characterized by sarakta piḍakācitam/ sarāgaḥ piṭikācitā [main lesion surrounded by reddish many small lesions], maṇḍalākāra piḍakā [rounded eruptions], vr̥tta piḍakā [rounded lesions], utsanna piḍakā [elevated lesions], rujākarī piḍakā [lesions associated with severe pain], vipula piḍakā [abundant papular lesions]
the disorder is characterized by gudaṁ bahiḥ nirgamanam [rectal prolapse]

the disorder is characterized by tvacō bahiḥ kīlōpamam [nail like projection from skin surface], sthiram [fixed projection], kharam [rough textured projection], tvacō bahiḥ arśaḥ [pile mass like projection from skin surface], maṣēbhyatūnnatatarā [more elevated than maśa], sitā [whitish projection], asita [blackish projection]
the disorder is characterized by tōda yukta kīlaḥ [projection associated with pricking pain], pāruṣya yuktaḥ [roughness/dryness]
the disorder is characterized by asita raktatā (kīla) [black pile mass]

the disorder is characterized by tvak savarṇa kīlaḥ [Skin coloured nail like projection], grathita kīlaḥ [knotted nail like projection over skin surface], snigdha kīlaḥ [unctuous nail like projection]

the disorder is characterized by nakha vēṣṭka māṁsa dāhaḥ [burning sensation in lateral wall of eponychium], nakha vēṣṭka māṁsa pākaḥ [pus formation in the lateral wall of eponychium], carma nakhāntarē bhr̥śa dāhaḥ [intense burning sensation in the area between nails and skin underneath the nails], carma nakhāntarē bhr̥śa pākaḥ [intense burning sensation in the area between nails and skin underneath the nails], jvaraḥ [fever], nakha māṁsa ruka [pain over and under nails]

the disorder is characterized by nīrujaṁ maṇḍalaḥ [painless circular lesion], utsanna maṇḍalaḥ [slightly elevated from skin surface], samaṁ (sūkṣma) [minute lesion], īṣata raktam/ lōhitam maṇḍalaḥ [reddish or reddish tinged], ślakṣaṇa [smooth textured lesion], carmakīlavat [appear like carmakīla], sahaja [present since birth / congenital]

the disorder is characterized by manda visarpaṇa śōphaḥ [slow spreading swelling], apāka śōphaḥ [swelling with less tendency to suppurate], tanu śōphaḥ [little swelling], tāmra varṇa śōphaḥ [copper coloured swelling], jvarakr̥ta [associated with fever]

the disorder is characterized by tvakasthaḥ kr̥ṣṇa varṇā [Black coloured lesion localized on skin surface], tilamātrāṇi [sesame sized lesion], nīrujaḥ [painless lesion], tvaka samaḥ [macular lesion/unelevated from skin]

the disorder is characterized by gātradēśē maṇḍalam [circular patches on body], mahat maṇḍalam [large sized patches], alpa maṇḍalam [small sized patches], śyāma maṇḍalam [bluish black coloured patches], asita maṇḍalam [blackish coloured patches], nirujaṁ [painless patches]

the disorder is characterized by mūtrasrōtaḥ ruṇaddhi [obstruction to urinary tract/meatus], mūtram manda dhārayā pravartatē [weak urine flow], maṇirna ca vidīryatē [inability to retract prepuce], mūtram mandadhārayā avēdanam pravartatē [painless urination without force]

the disorder is characterized by gātrē kr̥ṣṇā maṇḍalaḥ [Black coloured cicular lesion on body], mukhē kr̥ṣṇā maṇḍalaḥ [Black coloured circular lesion on face], nīruja maṇḍalaḥ [painless circular lesion], tanukaṁ [thin lesion over body or face]

the disorder is characterized by ugraruk [associated with severe pain], karṇasya upari dēśēpiḍikā [nodular swelling over ear pinna], karṇasya samantāt piḍikā [nodular swelling in the surrounding of external ear], karṇasya pr̥ṣṭha dēśē piḍikā [nodular swelling on the posterior surface of pinna], śālūkavat [nodule that resembles the root of lotus], kaṭhina piḍikā [hard nodular swelling], sthira piḍikā [fixed nodular swelling]

the disorder is characterized by alpa kaṇḍu [mild or no itching], tvak pāṇḍutā [pale coloured skin], prasuptiḥ [numbness], kramēṇa vicētanā (tvaka) [gradual loss of tactile sensation in skin], aviklēdaḥ [absence of oozing and moistness]

the disorder is characterized by kaṇṭakairācitam [Thorny projections], vr̥tta maṇḍlam [circular elevated lesions], kaṇḍūmat [associated with itching], padminī kaṇṭakavata [thorny projections that appear like lotus], nīrujaḥ [painless], śvētaḥ/ pāṇḍu [whitish projection]
the disorder is characterized by maṇēradhastād kōśasca granthirūpēṇa lambatē [foreskin of prepuce gets stuck behind the glans penis and hangs underneath like a gland]

the disorder is characterized by sarujaḥ/savēdanaḥ [painful swelling that hangs underneath the prepuce], sadāhaśc kvacit vrajēt [may be associated with burning sensation], pākaṁ kvacit vrajēt [may be associated with suppuration]
the disorder is characterized by sakaṇḍu [associated with itching], kaṭhinaḥ [hard in nature]
the disorder is characterized by pād tala dāraṇa [Fissuring and cracking of feet], sarujaḥ [associated with pain]

the disorder is characterized by hanusandhija śōphaḥ [Swelling in the joint of lower jaw], alpa rujaḥ śōphaḥ (hanu sandhi) [swelling with pain in joint of lower jaw], sthira śōphaḥ [firm swelling in the joint of lower jaw]

the disorder is characterized by avēdanā maṇḍalaḥ gātrēṣu [painless round lesions in the body], māṣavat maṇḍalaḥ [lesion that appear like māṣa (black gram)], kr̥ṣṇa maṇḍalaḥ [blackish coloured lesion], utsanna maṇḍalaḥ [elevated from the skin surface]

the disorder is characterized by grathita piḍakā [knotted lesions], māṁsa saṁśrita piḍakā [lesions located in muscle tissue], yavākāraḥ piḍakā [barley shaped lesions (thin rimed thick in the middle)], sukaṭhina piḍakā [very hard lesions]

the disorder is characterized by śālmalī kaṇṭakākāra piḍakā [lesion resembling the prickles of silk cotton tree], yūnaṁ vaktrē [occurs in the face of young people], sarujaḥ [associated with pain], ghanaḥ [thick and dense lesion], mēdōgarbhaḥ [presence of fatty pultaceous material inside the lesion]

the disorder is characterized by rājikā varṇa saṁsthāna pramāṇa piṭikā [papules resembling the shape size and appearance of mustard seed], ghana piṭikā [lesions that are thick and dense], saruja piṭikā [associated with pain]
the disorder is characterized by kr̥ṣṇaṁ maṇḍala [black coloured patch], sita maṇḍala [white coloured patch], sama maṇḍala [unelevated patch]
the disorder is characterized by kaṇḍūḥ [itching], srāvahīna piḍakā [papule without discharge]
the disorder is characterized by pracyāvati rōmāṇi [fall of hairs], anyēṣām asambhavaḥ [Absence of hair regrowth in that area]

the disorder is characterized by tīvra vēdanā [severe pain], kaṇḍūmān [itching sensation], jvaraḥ [fever], tvak pākaḥ [associated with suppuration of the skin], sadāhaḥ [associated with burning sensation], rakta paryantaḥ [reddish coloured appearance of circumference of lesion]

the disorder is characterized by pāṇitalē valmīkavat aṇubhiḥmukhaiḥgranthiḥ [occurrence of lesion with multiple minute opening in palm resembling ant-hill], pādatalē valmīkavat bahu aṇubhiḥmukhaiḥgranthiḥ [occurrence of lesion with multiple minute opening in sole resembling ant-hill], jatrūrdhvē valmīkavat bahu aṇubhiḥmukhaiḥgranthiḥ [occurrence of lesion with multiple minute opening in supra-clavicular region resembling ant-hill], sandhau valmīkavat bahu aṇubhiḥ mukhaiḥgranthiḥ [occurrence of lesion with multiple minute opening at joints resembling ant-hill], ruk [pain], kaṇḍūḥ [associated with itching], dāha/paridāha [burning sensation], klēdāḍhyam [excessive sticky discharge], śanaiḥ samupacīyatē [gradual development], tōda [pricking pain]
the disorder is characterized by mukhē śyāva maṇḍalam [blackish or brownish circular patch on face], tanu [patch which is thin], nīrujam [painless patches]

the disorder is characterized by vidārīkandavat vr̥tt piḍakā [round papule resembling a vidārī tuber], kakṣadēśē (vidārīkandavat vr̥tt piḍakā) [curcular lesion like vidārikanda in axilla], vaṁkṣaṇadēśē (vidārīkandavat vr̥tt piḍakā) [curcular lesion like vidārikanda in groin]

the disorder is characterized by pakvōdumbara sannibhām [lesion resembling a ripe fig], mahādāhaḥ [intense burning sensation], vivr̥tāsyām/vivr̥tānanā [lesion with wide opening], vr̥ttā [round shaped], jvaraḥ [fever]

short_definition: bulb of lotus flower like skin lesion
long_definition: the disorder is characterized by padmakarṇikākārā piṭikā [Eruption resembling bulb of lotus flower]
the disorder is characterized by agnidagdhanibhāḥ [appearance resembling burnt scar], sphōṭāḥ [blisters], sajvarāḥ [associated with fever]

the disorder is characterized by sakr̥ṣṇavarṇatā [blackish discolouration], jvaraḥ [fever], tr̥ṭ [thirst], parvabhēdanam [breaking type of pain in small joints], śirōruk [headache], śūla bhūyiṣṭham [severe pain]

short_definition: first stage of darvikara snake poison
long_definition: the disorder is characterized by śōṇitaṁ kr̥ṣṇatāmupaiti [blood turns to black], aṁgakārṣṇyam/vaktrādiśyāvatā [darkness of body/ face], pipīlikā parisarpaṇam iva aṁgē/ kīṭakāḥ sarpanti iva [feeling of moving of ants on body]

short_definition: second stage of darvikara snake poison
long_definition: the disorder is characterized by atyarthaṁ kr̥ṣṇatā (aṅgē) [excessively blackness of bodyparts], śōphaḥ [oedema], granthayaḥ [nodular swelling]

short_definition: third stage of darvikara snake poison
long_definition: the disorder is characterized by dṁśaklēdaḥ/daṁśaviklēdaḥ [wetness at bite site], śirōgauravam/mūrdhagauravam [heaviness of body], svēdaḥ [perspiration], cakṣuḥ grahaṇam/dr̥grōdhaḥ [lacking sight]

short_definition: fourth stage of darvikara snake poison
long_definition: the disorder is characterized by tandrā [drowsiness/lassitude], prasēkaḥ [excessive salivation], sandhiviślēṣaḥ [loosening /dislocation of joints], ṣṭhīvanam [Spitting/excess expectoration], vamiḥ [vomiting]

short_definition: fifth stage of darvikara snake poison
long_definition: the disorder is characterized by parvabhēdaḥ [breaking type of pain in small joints], hikkā/hidhmā [hiccup], dāhaḥ [burning sensation], sandhiviślēṣaḥ [loosening /dislocation of joints]

short_definition: sixth stage of darvikara snake poison
